commitResults.messageTitle: Replaced Duke.java with Colress.java. Updated greeting and exit messages.
Added echo method and class-level fields to initialise scanner, receive and store inputs, initialise messages and detect exit command.

Added a class-level ArrayList to store input strings. Added listEmptyMessage field to display a unique message if there are no inputs stored yet. Added a listCommand field to detect list command. Replaced echo method with makeList method and added printList method which iterates over the ArrayList and prints the entries in list format.

Added new Task class to encapsulate Task object. Each Task has a description field of type String and isDone field of type boolean. Changed ArrayList generic typing from String to Task. Added getInput method that obtains input from user and assigns it to a class-level input field. Added addTask and editTask methods, and more command fields to facilitate adding items to list and checking and unchecking items in the list. Added invalidCommandMessage field to detect any non-command inputs.
Renamed toDoList to taskList. Changed makeList method and addTask method to accomodate for all three types of tasks.

Updated runtest.bat to input the contents in input.txt into Colress.java. Updated EXPECTED.TXT file and input.txt file for testing. Updated spacer field in Colress.java to be longer so that all outputs are contained within the spacers. Fixed a bug in printList method in Colress.java where an unintended output is obtained when attempting to print an empty list.

Added two new checked exception classes to catch unknown commands and unknown task types. Added try-catch blocks in Colress.java to handle exceptions. Tweaked messages to make Colress sound less like a servant.
Added deleteCommand to facilitate deleting items. Updated editList method to check for deletion cases.
Updated UnknownCommandException.java to include delete in the command list. Updated test cases and expected results to test for deletion of items. Added full stops in Colress' messages
Added class-level String fields to instantiate prompts and messages. Added more test cases.
Update code such that it adheres to the Java Coding Standard.
commitResults.messageBody:
Constants have all been changed to uppercase with underscores to separate words. Constants that are related also share a prefix instead of a suffix.
Constants have also been rearranged such that all related constants are grouped together.
taskList ArrayList object has been changed to tasks.
Switch statements have been changed such that there is no indentation for the case statements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update EXPECTED.TXT and update getInput method to convert all input to lower case.
Add task saving functionality to Colress.
commitResults.messageBody:
Colress now writes tasks into a task.txt file, allowing users to save their task list when they exit the program.
The next time the program is run, Colress reads the task.txt file and repopulates the tasks ArrayList, or creates a new task.txt file if an existing task.txt file does not exist.

Update toString values of each task class such that delimiters are used.

This allows Colress to read the task.txt file and repopulate the tasks ArrayList

Update input.txt and EXPECTED.TXT to reflect the changes made to the task classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Colress such that data that is not in the expected format is handled
Add functionality that allows Colress to recognise date and time in a more meaningful way.
commitResults.messageBody:
Dates and times in deadline and event tasks are now stored as LocalDate and LocalTime respectively.
Each task class now has an additional toTextFile method that outputs a format similar to toString method in Level-7
toString method now outputs a format similar to before Level-7 commits
